alert.note: Alert for De Soto; Natchitoches; Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 23 at 8:50PM CST until January 23 at 11:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern De Soto Parish in northwestern Louisiana... West Central Natchitoches Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Sabine Parish in northwestern Louisiana... Northwestern Sabine County in eastern Texas... Northeastern San Augustine County in eastern Texas... Eastern Shelby County in eastern Texas... * Until 1100 PM CST. * At 850 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mansfield, Milam, Zwolle, Converse, Patroon, Shelbyville, Neuville, Bland Lake, Oak Grove, Pleasant Hill, Huxley, South Mansfield, Noble, Grand Cane, Stanley, Toledo Bend Reservoir North, Jordans Store, Sexton, Hurstown and Pelican. This includes the following streams and drainages... Cypress Bayou, Beauchamp Creek, Heart Bayou, Scie, Bayou, Big Iron Ore Creek, Wallace Creek, Louies Bayou, Lick Creek, Caney Creek, Tenaha Creek, South Bayou Blue, Tiger Creek, Na Bonchasse, Bayou, Ayish Bayou, Stinkfinger Creek, Lost Bayou, Sabine River, Baget Creek, Carrizo Creek, Boyd Creek, Spring Creek, Flat Fork Creek, Yellow Branch, Thompson Creek, San Miguel, Bayou, Dry Bayou, Huana Creek, Wooten Creek, Allen Creek, Canadian Bayou, McGrue Creek, Sulphur Creek, Boregas Creek, Brushy Bayou, Cook Creek, Duke Bayou, Chatman Bayou, Blanchard Bayou, Morrison Creek, McDonald Bayou, Higgenbotham Branch, El Lobanillo Creek, Mill Creek, Brady Creek, Castor, Bayou, Palo Gaucho Bayou, Patroon Bayou, Butler Creek, Perkins Creek, Brawley Creek, Wallace Bayou, Siep, Bayou, North Bayou Blue, Tenmile Bayou, Buckley Creek, Clement Creek, San Miguel Creek, Hollis Creek, Bourghs Creek, Rascal Creek, Bull Bay Creek, Fraigeson Creek, Chambers Creek, Bear Creek, West Branch Dolet Bayou, Reeves Creek, Bossier Bayou, Jims River, Grannies Creek, Liton Branch, Prairie Bayou, Siphorien Bayou, Belle Bayou, Pierre, Bayou, Buffalo Bayou, Mustang Creek, Prairie Creek, Bayou San Patricio, Cow Bayou and Jackson Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
